result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Belmarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  Court administratively ordered to be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never posssess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No contact with the victim.
No contact with children under the age of 12 years.

Comply with the standard rule sof probation/extended supervision.
Cooperate and particpate with a sex offender evaluation.  Follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and particpate with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the probation department.
Restitution set at zero.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
*9/15/2015 set at $450.00 payable to the victim Autumn G.-R.  To be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. jbs
on count one.  Defendant's address:  Scott Belmarez #633554, Stanley Correctional Institution, 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley, WI  54768.
Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (20 pages) commencing AUGUST 18, 2015.
Per request of court reporter.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott Belmarez in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Scott Belmarez in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Restitution Hearing held.
Arguments heard.

COURT'S RULING:  Court re-opened the judgment of conviction and ordered restitution set at $450.00 payable to the victim, A. G-R.  Court "administratively" ordered restitution to be paid over the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
RESTITUTION WORKSHEET filed by ADA Kevin Shomin on behalf of the State.

ADA Kevin Shomin called the clerk today to schedule a Restitution Hearing.  Per ADA Shomin, Atty. Avery Goodrich is available on 09-15-2015.  Case adjourned to 09-15-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.  Clerk affectuated defendant to be produced.

Defendant Scott Belmarez in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Scott Belmarez in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS. 
Credit given for 141 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 9 MONTHS "condition time" as straight time.  To be served forthwith.
* No contact with the victim.
* No contact with children under the age of 12 years.
* Complete a school program or job training program.
* Obtain a GED or HSED.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Cooperate and participate with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Probation Department.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  Court "administratively" ordered to be paid over the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Court "administratively" ordered to be paid over the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Scott Belmarez in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Scott Belmarez in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State withdraws the Amended Information.   Court will proceed on the original information.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

On motion of the defense, Court orders a presentence investigation.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Belmarez in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Scott Belmarez in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

There is a possible resolution on this case.  Parties ask for an adjournment.  Court grants adjournment.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Scott Belmarez not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State advises the Court they will file an Amended Information.  Court orders State to file the Amended Informtion by 6-29-15.  State has another jury trial set on 7-22-15 in Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Scott Belmarez not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense requests a further pretrial date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:32 am.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Scott Belmarez not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs to review discovery with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Belmarez in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Scott Belmarez in custody.  Ronald Dague for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing ,portable breathalyzers and SCRAM. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: AG dob: 7/9/1997 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Scott Belmarez in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Scott Belmarez in custody.  
Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Order denying petition to remove address received and filed.  Copy mailed to petitioner./ds
